subject: Management
title: Psychological Safety
description: A quick win: understand Psychological Safety.

hook.text: Google studied 180 teams. The number-one factor in top teams wasn't talent. It was psychological safety.

buildup.text: Psychological safety means people can speak up, ask questions, and admit mistakes without punishment.

discovery.text: Amy Edmondson's research: teams with safety learn faster, innovate more, and catch errors sooner.

twist.text: Safety doesn't mean comfort. High-performing teams have safety and high standards simultaneously.

climax.text: Model vulnerability. Thank people for raising problems. Punish silence, not mistakes.

punchline.text: People do their best work when they're not afraid.

quiz.question: What did Google's Project Aristotle find was the top factor in great teams?
options: Psychological safety, the ability to take risks without fear of punishment
Having the most talented individuals on the team
Strong top-down leadership with clear authority
